results.title: One perfect day
results.creator_credit: Lightstream films, Phil Gregory, Paul Currie and Charles Morton
results.brief_description: Follow the journey of music composer Tommy Matisse (Dan Speilman) as he studies music in England - a world away from lover Alysse (Abie Cornish) back in Australia. His creative process is to listen to the sounds around him, make music that moves him and affects others. The bond of music might or might not be strong enough to reunite the two when through family tragedy Tommy returns to Australia. Original music by David Hobson. Debut feature film by director Paul Currie. Cast includes Kerrie Armstrong, Leeanna Walsman, Andrew Howard, Nathan Phillips.

results.title: One night stand
results.creator_credit: Astra Film Productions, Richard Mason, Simon Wincer and John Duigan
results.brief_description: On the eve of World war three a group of young people find themselves in the deserted Sydney Opera House. As they hear that war has broken out in Europe and heads for Australia, the four spend what may be their last New Year’s Eve amusing themselves and growing closer in friendship. Cast: Tyler Coppin, Cassandra Delaney, Jay Hackett, Saskia Post, Midnight Oil.

results.title: One hundred and one dalmatians = 101 dalmations
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney, Wolfgang Reitherman, Hamilton Luske and Clyde Geronimi
results.brief_description: Pongo and Perdita settle into their owner’s home and become the proud parents of fifteen beautiful dalmation puppies. Cruella De Vil thinks that the litter would make a perfect dogskin coat and with the help of her henchmen, steals the puppies. Pongo and Perdita and their canine friends, embark on a dangerous rescue mission, and at last are reunited with their children and more dalmations! Based on the novel by Dodie Smith. Features the voices of Rod Taylor, Betty Lou Gerson, Cate Bauer, Lisa Daniels, Ben Wright and others.

results.title: One flew over the cuckoo's nest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fantasy Films, Saul Zaentz, Michael Douglas and Milos Forman
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Ken Kesey, this wry film stars Jack Nicholson as an inmate feigning insanity in an asylum. Nurse Ratchitt (Louise Fletcher) a woman whose cool, controlled demeanour masks her own form of insanity in the execution of iron-fisted control over her domain and all who come under her care. The story is an allegory of an era. While the people may seem crazy, it is the system which defines craziness, and by doing so, it is the system which has problems; not those who suffer under it. Few other films have made such a strong impression on repeated generations of filmgoers, and few films will ever match the power and integrity of this masterpiece. Winner of four 1975 Academy Awards: Best Director, Actor, Actress and Adapted screenplay.

results.title: One fine day (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lynda Obst and Michael Hoffman
results.brief_description: An unlikely romance develops when two single parents share babysitting for a day. Melanie (Michelle Pfeiffer), is a single mother with a busy career as an architect. Jack (George Clooney), is a commitment-shy newspaper columnist who has access to his daughter on the weekends, although his ex-wife’s sudden elopement has Jack looking after his daughter during the week. When their children miss the boat for a class field trip, Jack and Melanie agree to share babysitting shifts, leading to a day of interesting and romantic developments as they struggle with their day to day work, the children, and the feelings that are developing between them. Cast includes Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman and Charles Durning.

results.title: One eyed Jacks
results.creator_credit: Pennebaker Hegedus Films, Frank Rosenberg and Marlon Brando
results.brief_description: Charles Neider’s novel “The authentic death of Hendry Jones” is the source of this tellingly direct screenplay. It is the brooding, deliberate tale of a young man (Marlon Brando) consumed by a passion for revenge after he is betrayed by an accomplice (Karl Malden) in a bank robbery, for which crime he spends five years (1880-85) in a Mexican prison. His vengeful campaign leads him to the town of Monterey, where Malden has attained respectability and the position of sheriff, but romantic entanglements with Malden’s stepdaughter (Pina Pellicer) persuade Brando to abandon his intention until the irresistibility of circumstance and Malden’s own irrepressible will to snuff out the living evidence of his guilt draws the two men into a showdown. This film is a violent story of double-cross, suspicion and betrayal, and ranks as one of the all-time great Westerns. Watch for a special appearance by one of the movies great “cowboy” actors - Ben Johnson.

results.title: One deadly summer = L'Ete Meurtrier
results.creator_credit: CAPAC, Societe Nouvelle de Cinematographie, TF1 Films productions, Christine Beyout and Jean Becker
results.brief_description: Isabelle Adjani plays Elle, a fiery nineteen-year-old woman who moves to a small provincial French town with her introverted German born mother and reclusive disabled father. Elle is a confident woman who wantonly displays her sexy body and soon has every man in town captivated. Alain Souchon plays Pin Pon, a mechanic who falls into an obsession with Elle, and agonizes over invalidated rumours of other men’s conquests of her. Motivated by revenge, Elle easily draws Pin Pon into her orbit and soon moves in with him, despite the disapproval of his pious mother. Through a series of flashbacks it is revealed that twenty years earlier, in the post war period, Elle’s mother was brutally gang raped by several French deliverymen. Elle, tortured by issues of her parentage, is driven to avenge her mother’s rape but is also stirred by secrets from her own past that exacerbate her increasingly unstable mental condition. The switching of first person narration allows for multiple viewpoints to be appreciated by the viewer. This is a tragedy about vengeance, obsessive behaviour and neuroses. (Awards: Adjani won a Cesar for Best supporting actress, 1983). In French with English subtitles.

results.title: One day in September
results.creator_credit: Passion Pictures, Arthur Cohn Productions, Arthur Cohn, Battsek and Kevin MacDonald
results.brief_description: One day in September is a tense and vivid account of the 1972 Munich Olympics, where a group of Israeli athletes were taken hostage by the Palestinian terrorist group, Black September. Director Kevin Macdonald revisit’s the volatile situation through archival news footage and interviews with family members of the victims, Olympic officials and the only surviving member of the Black September group, Jamal Al Gashey. Starting on a rather ironic 70’s travelog of Munich, the documentary rapidly pieces together the tentative political climate at the time, cumulating in the eventual media circus surrounding the kidnappings and the ill conceived rescue mission mounted by the Munich police. Narrated by Michael Douglas. (Awards: Academy award, Best Feature Documentary 2000)

results.title: Once were warriors (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Communicado, New Zealand Film Commission, Avalon Studios, New Zealand On Air, Robin Scholes and Lee Tamahori
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Duff’s controversial best seller, “Once Were Warriors” is an intense and powerful film that leaves audiences stunned with its uncompromising insight into the strength of Maori culture in the face of degrading urban ghettos and devastating family violence. Jake (Temuera Morrison) and Beth (Rena Owen) have been married 18 years and she still finds him irresistible. Jake is a muscular, handsome man who exudes an explosive sexual energy but spends most of the time at the pub, often proving his masculinity with his fists and regularly exploding into rages that leave terrible scars on Beth and his family.
